title: Computational Modeling of Deep Multiresolution-Fractal Texture and Its Application to Abnormal Brain Tissue Segmentation. (arXiv:2306.04754v1 [eess.IV])
abstract: Computational modeling of Multiresolution- Fractional Brownian motion (fBm) has been effective in stochastic multiscale fractal texture feature extraction and machine learning of abnormal brain tissue segmentation. Further, deep multiresolution methods have been used for pixel-wise brain tissue segmentation. Robust tissue segmentation and volumetric measurement may provide more objective quantification of disease burden and offer improved tracking of treatment response for the disease. However, we posit that computational modeling of deep multiresolution fractal texture features may offer elegant feature learning. Consequently, this work proposes novel modeling of Multiresolution Fractal Deep Neural Network (MFDNN) and its computational implementation that mathematically combines a multiresolution fBm model and deep multiresolution analysis. The proposed full 3D MFDNN model offers the desirable properties of estimating multiresolution stochastic texture features by analyzing large amou

Title: Computational Modeling of Deep Multiresolution-Fractal Texture and Its Application to Abnormal Brain Tissue Segmentation. (arXiv:2306.04754v1 [eess.IV])
Abstract: Computational modeling of Multiresolution- Fractional Brownian motion (fBm) has been effective in stochastic multiscale fractal texture feature extraction and machine learning of abnormal brain tissue segmentation. Further, deep multiresolution methods have been used for pixel-wise brain tissue segmentation. Robust tissue segmentation and volumetric measurement may provide more objective quantification of disease burden and offer improved tracking of treatment response for the disease. However, we posit that computational modeling of deep multiresolution fractal texture features may offer elegant feature learning. Consequently, this work proposes novel modeling of Multiresolution Fractal Deep Neural Network (MFDNN) and its computational implementation that mathematically combines a multiresolution fBm model and deep multiresolution analysis. The proposed full 3D MFDNN model offers the desirable properties of estimating multiresolution stochastic texture features by analyzing large amou
tldr: 本论文提出了一种用于异常脑组织分割的多尺度分形深度神经网络模型（MFDNN），其结合了多尺度 fBm 模型和深度多尺度分析，能够对多尺度随机纹理特征进行估计，并在分割方面有应用潜力。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel Multiresolution Fractal Deep Neural Network (MFDNN) model for abnormal brain tissue segmentation, which combines the multiresolution fBm model and deep multiresolution analysis for feature learning. The MFDNN model offers the ability to estimate multiscale stochastic texture features and shows potential for brain tissue segmentation.
